Description: Three fragments of a wide, wool and silk, tapestry band (single warp threads) on a mainly dark red ground; Possibly from a garment; Motifs mainly in white, yellow and green and outlined in black and/or yellow; On the right of fragment (a) the remains of flatened roundel containg a stylised horse and rider, on the left is an eight lobed medallion containing stylised plant forms on a black ground; Various other animals and plant forms and border of small scale rinceaux between plain strips; Warp: black wool, S spun, c.11 tpc; Weft: wool, S spun, yellow silk slight Z twist, c.40 tpc; Edges: ragged except in seam where hidden; Sewing: seam with turned under seam allowances, wool (S spun, Z ply) thread.
Curator's comments: Part of OA.757. Previous location Cupboard 64, in red box. Decorative band woven as part of a larger textile, mainly black tunic? Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (6.6.1990)
Condition: In fragments. At unknown date stuck to sticky net.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Maj William Joseph Myers (executors of)
